congVote.result: So the resolution was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Tsunami Warning, Education, and Research Act
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: Pursuant to H. Res. 934, the House concurred in the Senate amendment to H.R. 34, to authorize and strengthen the tsunami detection, forecast, warning, research, and mitigation program of the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, with an amendment consisting of the text of Rules Committee Print 114-67, modified by the amendment printed in part A of H. Rept. 114-839, in lieu of the matter proposed to be added by the Senate, by a recorded vote of 392 ayes to 26 noes, Roll No. 592.<P/>H. Res. 934, the rule providing for consideration of the Senate amendment to the bill (H.R. 34) and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 6392) was agreed to by a yea-and-nay vote of 230 yeas to 180 nays, Roll No. 590, after the previous question was ordered without objection.

titleInfo.title: PROTECTING VETERANS' EDUCATIONAL CHOICE ACT OF 2016

extension.searchTitle: PROTECTING VETERANS' EDUCATIONAL CHOICE ACT OF 2016; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 171

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the bill was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory2: Protecting Veterans' Educational Choice Act of 2016
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measure which was debated on Tuesday, November 29th:<P/>H.R. 5047, to direct the Secretary of Veterans Affairs and the Secretary of Labor to provide information to veterans and members of the Armed Forces about articulation agreements between institutions of higher learning, by a \2/3\ yea-and-nay vote of 411 yeas to 3 nays, Roll No. 591.

congVote.dailyDigestCategory2: Intelligence Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2017
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measures:<P/>H.R. 6393, to authorize appropriations for fiscal year 2017 for intelligence and intelligence-related activities of the United States Government, the Community Management Account, and the Central Intelligence Agency Retirement and Disability System, by a \2/3\ yea-and-nay vote of 390 yeas to 30 nays, Roll No. 593.
